attributes.action: Change the DDA 1991 to end breed discrimination and focus on behaviour
attributes.additional_details: Breed-specific laws have not reduced dog attacks and unfairly punish dogs based on looks, not behaviour. Data shows aggression is linked to ownership and training. We need effective, evidence-based laws that focus on behaviour, enforce accountability, and support public education to truly keep people safe.
attributes.background: To reform the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991 by removing breed-specific legislation and replacing it with behaviour-based laws. Focus on responsible ownership, training, and education to improve public safety without unfairly targeting certain dog breeds.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716062
